result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Arraignment on November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:12 AM Defendant Alexis O Lopez in court, in custody.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Alexis O Lopez.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Molly Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty. Nimmer states the amended complaint that takes care of the some of the issues in the motion to dismiss.  Amended complaint filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of amended complaint and waives reading of complaint. Atty. Nimmer moves to dismiss count #2 and withdraws the motion in regards to count #1.  Atty. Schmidt objects.  Court denies the motion to dismiss.  City of Brookfield police officer Nicholas Jacks sworn and testified on direct by Atty. Schmidt.  Cross examination by Atty. Nimmer.  State rests.  Testimony closed.  Atty. Schmidt moves for bind over and makes closing statements.  Atty. Nimmer makes closing statements and objects to bind over and moves to dismiss counts #1, 2 and 3.  Atty. Schmidt makes rebuttal statement.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Waive reading of Information. Bail remains as fixed. Defense received discovery.  Atty. Nimmer requests an arraignment be set with the 11/14/2022 hearing.  Atty. Nimmer will be filing a substitution of judge on this case before the next hearing.
Arraignment scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Motion to dismiss complaint

10:14 AM Defendant Alexis O Lopez in court, in custody.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Alexis O Lopez.  Prosecuting attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
State is in compliance with victim's rights. 
Cases called to address Motion to Modify Bond in 22CF1452. The other cases tagalong. 
Atty Nimmer makes arguments on the record.
The State objects to any modification of bond amount.
Court denies the motion for modification of bond for reasons as stated on the record. 
Case 22CF1452 already set for Preliminary Hearing with other cases tagging along.
Hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on September 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Preliminary hearing on September 30, 2022 at 09:15 am.

proposed protective order
The original document was titled: proposed protective order
The original history event date is: 09-14-2022

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victim A, B, or C listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 0.5 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms. Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release. Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim A listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed.

2:10 PM Defendant Alexis O Lopez in court, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ricardo Tapia in court for Alexis O Lopez. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 20 DAYS.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:15 am.
